title: Downloading the alpha client on linux
body: Recently, I was given the chance to play on the new alpha client. The issue with this is that I am on linux, and the installation for league on linux requires further installation that it does on windows. My question is, can I get the alpha client on linux? If so, how?

replies.body: I don't know of anyone who has successfully ran the alpha client on Linux. But then again I don't know anyone who has been able to try yet. Until the Alpha client is widespread you unfortunately are unlikely to get much help.

Since we don't officially support Linux, I cannot assist you in troubleshooting or getting League working on it. A lot of players run League on Linux with the assistance of [**PlayOnLinux**](https://www.playonlinux.com/en/) or [**Wine**](https://www.winehq.org/). It's unlikely this will be an easy install, but those communities would be the best to reach out to for further assistance or advice when attempting to install the new client on your machine.

Best of luck.

i was playing league of legend on linux ubuntu 14.04 and 16.04 versions perfectly fine since yesterday... well, stupid me i deleted linux ubuntu and trying now Linux Mint 18, with same settings it's not working for now.
you need to install playonlinux software in your software manager, when installing choose 32 bits installations, download latest stagging version of vine (inside of playonlinux, DON'T DOWNLOAD VINE FROM SOFTWARE MANAGER), in wine configuration select windows version (i use windows 7) and stagging settings to activate CSMT, some people say you need to install vcrun2005-vcrun2010 (also inside of playonlinux) and probably last thing, when instalation offers you open client after instal complete, uncheck that... that should be enough for you to play league of legends on linux ubuntu
